page.title: 12The Library in Viewpark
page.content: The library is in a modern building at one end of Viewpark. It has over 3,500 members (1,100 junior). There are over 17,500 books (4,400 jun- ior) as well as music cassettes and computer games to borrow. There are th- ings on sale advertising the library. A librarian and three assistants make up the staff. In a week they issue about 2,000 books and 150 music tapes. They also issue toys from the toy corner. There is also a resource centre there which the public can use to have printing or photocopying done (10p). One section has reference books and another has leaflets telling you about rights and benefits. A local history corner has maps, photos and newspaper cuttings about the area. Some children go to get help with th- eir school work and are made welcome.
